Replies.Reply: I think we can begin... First parole request Carter "Doc" McCoy... is legal counsel present?
Carter McCoy, one to five years sentence for armed robbery, first offense in the State of Texas, wanted by the State of Ohio for assault with a deadly weapon and armed robbery...
That is correct. Very well. Mr. McCoy has served four years of his sentence. Prison record satisfactory. Applied for parole on September 5th of this year...
The Board met in closed chambers last week... have you reached a decision regarding Mr. McCoy's request for parole?
Very well. The next request for parole is from John Doty. Is legal counsel present?
Mr. Doty is serving five to twelve years for embezzlement of corporate funds.
The State of Ohio has waved jurisdiction, Mr. Chairman. They no longer seek Mr.
We would only again like to call the committee's attention to Mr. McCoy's satisfactory behavior as a prisoner.
lowers his eyes, then looks up at his lawyer. The lawyer avoids Doc's glance., he shuffles the papers in front of him, begins stuffing them into his briefcase.
No way. I've got to get out now.
I'm a lot better off than I was an hour ago.
My license expired, let's get out of here.
I want to take a walk.
I've been there every day for the last four years.
I hope so. I am not looking forward to another stretch.
Where did you get them developed?
That Beynon's got a long arm.
Couldn't handle it then. Now I can.
Yeah, well, I think I'll stick with what I've got.
All it takes is a long arm.
I guess it was because I was a model prisoner.
I heard about you. You work with Miller.
I'll take care of my end.
Could I get change for this fifty please?
... Bank President, three tellers and one guard...

Nail him first, be careful he doesn't panic and want to shoot somebody. Local police have one car, a rover, shouldn't be in the vicinity at the time we hit unless it's answering an emergency call... if the cop car shows up remember it doesn't have any automatic weapons.
Just in case someone gets a shot off.
Chambers - Reilly. Time lock opens 20 minutes before they start doing business...
One-inch stuff on a three-number combination.
I 'm handling the fine stuff. You're back up all the way...
Keep going over these. I don't want anybody getting lost.
What do you have in mind?
Tell Beynon I want no mistakes.
Beynon has to be alone at the drop ...
My mind's not on guessing games.
If it's funny I'm going to laugh.
Waiting's hard. You never learn how.
I know you do. But it is different.

Replies.Didascalie: (before she can interrupt suddenly up a notch)

Replies.Reply: We're just going to get the money and then go all the way.

Replies.Didascalie: (speaking over his shoulder, not looking at Rudy)

Replies.Reply: Jackson panicked and nailed the guard.
We got between four and five.
So what. I've got to give him his money.
I just figure the percentages. He wouldn't try a cross until he's got the money.
If we make a mistake., he'll burn us. You make a deal, you're always better keeping your end up.
You can wait here... I'll wrap it up fast.
Let's c ut up the money, I want to get North.
Replies.Didascalie: (moving right to the business at hand)

Replies.Reply: You hired Jackson and Rudy., not me.
No way. I always do my own work.
We only got a half a million.
So we did that crackerbox... to cover for you.
My old lady must have made a lot of promises.
When I got out, why didn't you tell me where it was?
If you don't start telling the truth...
checks his watch momentarily as he prowls the wagon between long rows of automobiles.
It isn't another boyfriend, is it?
He'd figure you for longer, enough time to try another hit. He's probably still in the station.
When you pop a lock don't mark it.
Look, I'm sure you're a nice kid and that your mother's nearby...
Your kind of mistakes are going to land me back in Huntsville.
Maybe we should split up... I'll cut the money with you.
We'll grab a room for tonight then you go out tomorrow and buy yourself some new clothes, pick some up for me... Grab some food now, paper bag it, we eat in the room.
When they find it, they find it.
No... there's a couple of things I'm still working on.
Replies.Didascalie: (looking at Carol and thinking about Beynon)

Replies.Reply: There may be a hunting party.
Loredo is out. I've been thinking about Rudy. If he was on his own, we're okay.
If Beynon bought him out, and he talked then maybe Beynon's boys will be waiting for us in El Paso.
I think you liked it with him.
When are you going to learn?
And that could be all for you., baby.
Now you learn3 this time it could be the chair for both of us.
From now on you just shut up and do as you're told.
You can't trust anything these days.
Want to see what I trust... In God we trust...

Replies.Didascalie: (he pulls out a bill and points at it)

Replies.Reply: We got trouble. Let's take a walk.
Sure can. I'd like an Invicta 12-gauge pump with the twenty-inch barrel.
That's okay, honey. Two cheeseburgers; two coffees and a milkshake.
Don't scratch it, just rub, you'll get an infection.
Do what I tell you, it's not a game.
We better stick here till tonight.
Listen to me. It's hard enough.
Look, what you said yesterday... I guess that was right. It isn't worth anything if we don't make it together.
Either we pick it up or else we leave it right here. We got to go one way or another.
You want to try with me?
We get to Mexico, we can have a life.
I'm going to try and get it for you.
My lady'11 come in in about five minutes.
When she gets here, have that kid of yours help her with the suitcase.
We've got some food coming, should be here any minute.
Ten. Laughlin's going to take us across at four A.M.
Jeep. There's a dry river bed fifteen miles east. He takes us to the Mexican side, drops us off at the airfield by breakfast... we've got a 9 o'clock flight.
Get upI Carol's eyes snap open.
Laughlin. He's always got his family around... that wife and kid of his have to stand by his side to make sure he stays off the juice and horses.
If they are not here, he must have sent them away.
Get your clothes on, move your butt.
You want it? Come and take it.
Mexico. I'd like to find a quiet place to cross.
I don't know, airport I guess.
Let's just get to the border.
Replies.Didascalie: (resigned to the insanity of the moment)

Replies.Reply: Listen... how much money did you make this year?
How about if I buy your car for ten grand?
You're going to have to walk back to the border.
Well, I paid a hell of a price. Now for God's sake keep your mouth shut.
Hell, I don't know... but we sure gave it a run.
Yeah, why not? We're the good guys.
Why don't you try the news?
Request for parole is denied. The prisoner may re-apply in one calendar year.

Replies.Didascalie: (big smile, she wants the moment to be an upper)

Replies.Reply: It's been raining a lot the last few days.
I want to see Jack Beynon.
Ready to talk about my husband, Mr.
He's asked me to come and see you.
I'm sorry I was late... I got my hair done... the girl was slow.
Where do you want to go?
What do you mean? You've never been there.
Small town, small bank, big money.
I made a mistake. I'll never make another one.
What do you want for dinner?

Replies.Didascalie: (as Doc eats a peach with a sharp knife)

Replies.Reply: Pretty good... Made a quick trip to Oregon, saw my brother and the kids.
Nothing's been boring since you found me.
No. It's been a long time.
After four years and now the question comes up.
We've got time. We've got a lot of time.
Listen, I'm just as nervous as you are.
Let me make you feel good, Doctor.
I was going to fix you breakfast.
I bought you a lot of new things.
You got the parole, didn't you?
But I got you out. Didn't I, Doc. I did it. I got you out.

I laugh when I feel happy. Sometimes just thinking of you made me laugh. I had a lot of that. And other times that wasn't enough. I had a lot of that too. I know you find it hard to believe, I'm happy just loving you.
But sometimes I cried a lot too.
I'd like an application for a checking account.
Usually on the right side as you go in.
If we are clean Gollie will take us over at Nogales. If we are hot we'll have to try Laughlin at El Paso.
Replies.Didascalie: (holding two passports and four visas held together by a rubber band)

Replies.Reply: I feel like the night before the first day of school.
It will be such a relief not to have to think about it any more.
You know I've actually gotten tired waiting sometimes... worn out waiting.
It doesn!t make much difference where you are, if you're waiting, Doc.
We are always going to be all right tomorrow. I'd like to be all right a few todays.
Call the ranch, tell Beynotr we'll leave his cut here --
He might be ready to chop us up.
I've never "been there... When we met it was in his office.
Let's send his cut back -- Just keep going.
I don't want to go there.
There wasn't any way to explain it.
What the hell do you want? Mary Tyler Moore?
Two day coach tickets -- on the Flyer.
That certainly makes you kind of special...
STANDS AND PAUSES FOR A MOMENT.
I really hope you have a nice trip.
A man helped me open it...
I wouldn't worry Doc. I can always get you out... I'll screw every prison official in Texas if I have to.
You'd do the same for me, wouldn't you, Doc?
If I was caught, wouldn't you?
When we had trouble before it was different.
What do you want to do?
No... I don't want to leave.
You've got all the answers. What about when they find the body on the train?
Why, there's nothing on the news?
Maybe. At least I got to him.
Where do we go from here?
That would be the first time.
I did I killed a man.
If I hadn't killed Beynon., you would have.
I'll tell you something, Doc. One day you're going to have to trust somebody...
You keep it up and it won't matter how far we get away, because it's going to be all over between you and me. Do you understand that? There won't be anything left.
I think so... I don't know.
It's all a game, don't bother me.
I don't want to hear it.
I don't think we can any more... If we ever get out of here, maybe I should take off...
We've come a lot of miles. But we're not close to anything.
I always thought jails make people hard.
Things can't get much worse can they?
That's all I want... It's the only thing I have ever wanted.
Great. I'm going to sleep twelve hours.
Get in the shower. You'll feel okay.
Sorry. Look, I'm clean. I want to get some rest.
Just leave it outside the door... I'm not dressed right now.
All right. You'll have to hold on a minute, my husband's in the shower...
Where do we go from here?
They will have our description before we can get a plane.
How long before this car's hot?
Tell her you robbed a bank...
Are we going to make it?
Whatever happens... we're going all the way.
No more news, from now on we're just going to listen to music.
The Doctor took out McGovern for her.
Just tell us the room number.
Now you want to tell me?
She only rides winning - Class easy class.
What about Laughlin in El Paso?
Mr. Beynon will see you the day after tomorrow 12:30 at the River Walk.
They may still be going to Nogales.
Cover both, get someone down there...
Tonight... take him out in the country, throw him down a dry well, if you can find one.
Just have her set it down.
So the good Doctor comes up again.
Not at all, just a pleasant way to have lunch.
Glad to see you in civilian clothes.
Hard to judge how these things happen.
This is the only time you and I meet in public. Any business with me, handle it with him...
You're back with your own people now. Got you some professionals.
You run the job, but I run the show. You got two weeks to set it up.
They're mine. The one with the moustache is my brother. They stay out of it. We stay clean.
They will be ready. You guys do your job.
Your wife told me no one would be killed.
They may nail me into this now, McCoy.
You know, you and I may be two of a kind.
Here. I understand the way you feel. As a matter of fact, you and I might share a great many feelings...
You still don't get the picture do you?
Let's examine the situation. One, an extremely attractive woman. Then, there's the woman's husband, a skillful bank robber serving a long sentence in prison.
A simple reason, McCoy. The obvious reason. To rob a bank.
What do you add up to here?
A little more was taken out before.
My brother's a director of that Bank, Mr.
But we are both not interested in that right now.
Close... but it takes a hell of a lot more than promises to pull the kind of strings I pulled.
You wouldn't have come here when you were eight3 Mr. McCoy.
Don't think too badly of her... After all, you were in jail a long time and she is a healthy young woman.
He leans against a low stone wall that lines the entrance way... The duffel bag rests beside him.
You're out of touch. Cops blew him up.
I worked ten years without one, I don't need one now.
Aren't we going a little hard?
It's just a walk-in bank. You don't have to be Dillinger for this one.
He didn't make it, Doc... you didn't either.
Replies.Didascalie: (pointing his gun lazily at Doc, supremely confident)

Replies.Reply: I got a nurse in mind.
The three of us are going to do some traveling. We're going to take your car to El Paso.
What kind of car do you have, Harold?
That's good. That's very good. Now Harold, you go out and gas up the Ford, check the oil and tires, we don't want any problems on the road. One more thing... If anybody but you comes back...
She gets her clock fixed right away...
After you come back I'll listen while you make some phone calls, tell a few friends you've got to leave for a week or two...
That makes things a little easier for us then, doesn't it?
How long have you been married?

Get rid of that nail polish, I don't like it, and when I tell you to come over here you move fast. You and I are going to get along because I've known a lot of people like you, so don't tell me about it because I got your ticket going in. Now get up and get that paint of your fingers... okay?
Talk a little, Harold, loosen up... good for you.
I Just want to find a suitcase.

How you doing over there, Harold? You sleep okay last night? Good. I'm glad to hear it. Did you listen to the news? That means we don't have to drive so hard today, Harold... we're gonna be travelling a lot faster than they are...
I'll tell you why I did it... it makes me feel good.
Harold, you've had ten minutes, get out of there.
Okay, sweetpea, you get two choices. Live or die.
Do what I tell you, you not only get to live, but maybe you'll pick up some money.
First things first. Main thing, you work for me, otherwise I get you. If I don't, six months from now one of my friends will.
I was backup man on a payroll job.
I hit some liquor stores... I drive good.
THE BANK CARRIES ON ITS NORMAL MID-DAY ACTIVITY. A Guard enters the building quickly followed by the bank President.
DOC CARRIES THE HEAVY SUITCASE IN HIS LEFT HAND. He gestures to Rudy and Jackson with his pistol while moving towards the side door.
Thirty-four fifty-six with tax leaves in forty-five minutes, gate three.
Collar bone is broken. No infection yet... the bandages should be changed twice a day.
The glucose will begin working in half an hour. You'll feel better then...
That's not possible. We can't leave here... we've got all this.
We really don't have too many friends.
Just... tell us what you want.
A Ford... We have a Ford.
You do what he says, Harold.
They don't think he married well.
I don't think you have to worry much about Harold. He won't do anything.
Look, I'm not going to be any trouble to you either, fact is, this may sound funny, but maybe you and I could be close friends...
You don't always have to have your gun out. I'll get whatever you want. Really, I will...
Something ought to loosen him up ... how comes we're going to El Paso, Rudy?
Oh, Christ, you wrecked my blouse.
It's your food, I brought up your sandwiches...
I can't do that, ma'am. You have to pay now so I can pay back the boy that went out and got the food...
Guess you have to catch a train?
Me, too. Got twenty-four days of furlough and I'm goin' home.
Utah, the Bee-Hive state. I'm from Orem, right near Salt Lake ... Say, you wouldn't happen to be a Mormon, would you?
Me, neither. There's about twelve people in the state that aren't Mormons and I'm one of them.
You wouldn't be taking the train to Salt Lake, would you?
Thanks. I hope yours is okay, too.

Replies.Reply: The Flyer now boarding at gate three. The Flyer now boarding at gate three.
Be open five minutes out of the station.
CARS, walking cautiously ahead. As the Flyer continues to move slowly forward, Doc disappears from view.
Listen, I'm a friend of the Court.
You are here because you're under arrest.

... The man has been positively identified as Carter Doc" McCoy, only recently paroled from a penitentiary where he was serving time for armed robbery. He is believed to be travelling with his wife, Carol Ainsley McCoy...
Yes, sir, and that's my wife and that's Junior.
No trouble. You came to the right place, one thing we got is a lot of rooms. What else can I do for you?
It's hard to figure. There's something about the composition of the track at Pimlico... You can't go by the clock, any speed horse, take a second off any other track in the country.
... but a speed horse is the only thing that consistently holds form. They got to let 'em run, dumb God damn trainers try to rate 'em, just breaks their heart.
Sure, Doc. I can do it. Just like old times... Yeah, it's a nervous way to live.
Growing -- all of them - every day.
318, you'll be the only ones on the floor.
Be one hundred and eighty-five thirty-
Could you roll it up part way?
THE STAIRWELL AROUND SWAIN DISINTEGRATES. The thug is obliterated by the firepower.
I guess you ain't gonna shoot me, are you?
That's good... I'll cooperate, don't worry about that... yes sir, I've had some trouble with the law myself.
Three years ago I dynamited some fish at the reservoir.
That little job cost me a hundred dollars... didn't even get to keep the fish.
Sure thing, mister, it's coming right up.
Don't you want to go to the airport?
And I keep my mouth shut?
I don't report the car and I don't know either of you?
Don't worry about me, I'll grab a cab...
Hope you get to where you're going.
By the way, you're getting a hell of a car there, mister.
Wish you hadn't said that. When Slim Canfield's lips are sealed, they're sealed.
One thing though... how do I explain this to my wife?
